metadata.title: CVE-2014-9033 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Certified (xenial) - medium
metadata.description:
Cross-site request forgery (CSRF) vulnerability in wp-login.php inWordPress 3.7.4, 3.8.4, 3.9.2, and 4.0 allows remote attackers to hijackthe authentication of arbitrary users for requests that reset passwords.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2014-9033` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

wordpress - 4.0.1+dfsg-1
wordpress-l10n - 4.0.1+dfsg-1
wordpress-theme-twentyfifteen - 4.0.1+dfsg-1
wordpress-theme-twentyfourteen - 4.0.1+dfsg-1
wordpress-theme-twentythirteen - 4.0.1+dfsg-1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: wordpress package in xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.0.1+dfsg-1').
